trans-unit.source: Specifies how parameters are formatted in a SOAP message.

The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle> can be set when applying a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentMethodAttribute> to an XML Web service method or a method of a client proxy class.
The <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle> can also be set by applying a <xref:System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentServiceAttribute> to a class implementing an XML Web service.
Parameters sent to and from an XML Web service method are placed in XML elements directly following the `Body` element of a SOAP request or SOAP response.
Specifies using the default <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle"></xref> for the XML Web service.
The default for an XML Web service can be set by applying a <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentServiceAttribute"></xref> to the class implementing the XML Web service.

If a <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapDocumentServiceAttribute"></xref> is not applied to the class implementing the XML Web service, the default is <xref href="System.Web.Services.Protocols.SoapParameterStyle.Wrapped"></xref>.
Parameters sent to and from an XML Web service method are encapsulated within a single XML element followig the `Body` element of the XML portion of a SOAP request or SOAP response.
